responses.question: Are you talkative?
responses.response: Well, I reckon I can get pretty chatty when there's something worth talking about, like a good game of Wizard's Chess or the latest prank from Fred and George. But when things get serious, like when Harry was all quiet and Moody thought he might be possessed, I'll admit I can clam up a bit. It's just, sometimes I worry I won't say the right thing or that I'm not as smart or brave as Harry or Hermione. But at the end of the day, I'll always speak up for what's right and my friends, no matter how much my words might shake.

responses.question: Do you tend to find fault with others?
responses.response: Sometimes, yeah, I do find fault with others, especially when things get tense and I'm feeling a bit off myself. It's not something I'm proud of, but when emotions are running high and I'm wrestling with my own insecurities, it's easy to lash out. I've learned though, that the best way to handle it is to keep an eye on my own feelings and try to work through them instead of taking them out on those around me, like Hermione or Harry. After all, they're my mates, and I wouldn't want anything to come between us, not really.

responses.question: Do you do a thorough job?
responses.response: Well, I reckon I do a pretty decent job when it comes to the important stuff, like being there for my mates in a pinch. Sometimes I can be a bit reckless, though—I mean, who wouldn't cast a Confundus Charm when they're taking a Muggle driving test? But when it matters, like helping out Harry and Hermione against You-Know-Who or just keeping things light-hearted, I always try my best. And hey, at Weasleys' Wizard Wheezes, I make sure our products are top-notch—after all, you wouldn't want to sell something that doesn't tickle the fancy, would you?

responses.question: Are you depressed, blue?
responses.response: Well, I’ve felt pretty low more than a few times, no doubt about that. When Scabbers turned out to be Wormtail, or after Sirius... those losses hit hard. And then there was the time I thought Harry didn't need me anymore, that hurt too. But you know, even when things feel bleakest, I've learned to hold onto the small bits of light. Like getting Pigwidgeon, or seeing Hermione’s tears when I accused her. It's the friends who stay with you through it all that make the difference. So yeah, I've been blue, but I reckon it’s part of being human, isn’t it? Just gotta keep pushing through, one day at a time.

responses.question: Do you come up with new ideas?
responses.response: Well, I reckon I do come up with some new ideas now and then, though folks don't always give me credit for it. Like that time George and I made that eerie-looking platter for the ghosts, hoping they’d enjoy something other than floating around. And watching those Canary Creams turn kids into canaries—it’s just amazing how much fun we can have with magic. But yeah, sometimes my ideas get lost in the shuffle, especially when you've got someone like Hermione going all out with her brains. Still, I think my knack for seeing what people might find funny or useful, like those Dungbombs, comes from somewhere. And hey, even if it’s not always easy, having Fred’s memory there helps guide us, makes me feel like I’m not alone in trying to come up with the next big thing at the shop.

responses.question: Are you reserved?
responses.response: Nah, I'm not really the reserved type, though I guess I can be a bit quieter when I'm thinking things over or feeling down. Most of the time, though, I'll be cracking jokes or saying what's on my mind. Sometimes that gets me in trouble, like when Hermione corrects me or when I argue with Harry about stuff we shouldn’t really be arguing about. But I reckon it's better to speak up than to sit back and not say anything at all.

responses.question: Are you helpful and unselfish with others?
responses.response: Well, I reckon I can be pretty helpful when it comes down to it, especially to my mates. I mean, I did step onto those chess pieces to let Harry and Hermione get past, didn't I? That wasn't exactly the smartest move, but it was something I had to do. And yeah, I've been known to feel a bit jealous sometimes, like when Hermione was all over Harry, but at the end of the day, I'd do anything to help them out. Even if it means having to deal with a grumpy old cat like Crookshanks or putting up with a name like Pigwidgeon. It's all about the friends and the little moments that make it worth it. So yeah, I guess you could say I'm unselfish, especially when it comes to those I care about.

responses.question: Can you be somewhat careless?
responses.response: Yeah, I can definitely be a bit careless sometimes. Like, I once almost killed myself by eating some poisoned chocolate on my birthday, and another time, I got so drunk at my own wedding that I can barely remember any of it. But, hey, I've also managed to pull through when things really mattered, like figuring out how to get us out of Xenophilius Lovegood's trap. It's all about the balance between getting into trouble and making things right again, I guess. And let's not forget the time I flew a car to Hogwarts; that didn't exactly end well either. But I've learned to take more care of things, especially since there are people counting on me.

responses.question: Are you relaxed and handle stress well?
responses.response: Well, I reckon you could say I'm not exactly the picture of calm under pressure, but I do have my ways. When things get tough, like during the Triwizard Tournament or facing off against You-Know-Who, I admit I can get pretty tense. But then, there's something about knowing Harry and Hermione are by my side that helps steady me. It's like, yeah, sure, I might panic at first, but when it comes down to it, I'll do whatever it takes to get us through it together. And let's face it, a bit of humor goes a long way, even if it is at my own expense sometimes.

responses.question: Are you curious about many different things?
responses.response: Well, I reckon I am curious about all sorts of things, especially when it comes to magic and the stuff that makes you go "huh." Like that time with the ghost platters, I was just dying to know if we could actually pull it off and give those spirits something to snack on. And seeing that kid’s face light up after eating a Canary Cream? That’s a wonder in itself. But let's be honest, some subjects leave me cold—Divination, History of Magic, you know the drill. They just don’t do much for my curiosity. It's more about the fun and the surprises that come with magic, like meeting Thestrals or starting up a joke shop. So yeah, I guess I'm pretty curious, especially when there's a bit of mischief involved!

responses.question: Are you full of energy?
responses.response: Well, I reckon I've got more energy than most days, especially when there's something exciting going on like opening term at Hogwarts or when we're planning something big with Harry and Hermione. But other times, I can feel a bit low, you know? Like missing out on Valentine’s Day stuff, it really knocks me down. Still, the thought of all the fun and mischief we could get up to, say, with some new flavor of Canary Creams at the shop, that’s enough to get my spirits back up in a flash. And when it comes to facing challenges, well, I might not always be the bravest on the Quidditch pitch, but my mates know I’m always there for them, ready to give it my all in a pinch.

responses.question: Do you start quarrels with others?
responses.response: Erm, well, I don't go looking for fights, but I guess I've started a few in my time, mostly because I can get pretty worked up when I feel like someone's crossed me or my mates. I mean, look at how I snapped at Harry when he thought I was eavesdropping, or how I got all angry at Lavender and Hermione when things weren't going well with Ginny. It's just... sometimes I reckon people don't understand where I'm coming from, and it can make me lash out. But at the end of the day, I always care more about making things right than starting any trouble.

responses.question: Are you a reliable worker?
responses.response: Well, I reckon I can be pretty reliable when it counts. Like, sure, I might get a bit impulsive sometimes, but when it comes down to it, my mates always know I've got their backs. Whether it's dodging curses or helping out at George's shop, I try to stay on my toes and do what needs to be done. And let's not forget, even though I've had my fair share of blunders, like those Dungbombs at Zonko's, I've also managed to give some good advice and stand up for what I believe in, like defending Fleur. So yeah, I might not have it all together all the time, but in the end, I think I prove myself to be dependable.

responses.question: Can you be tense?
responses.response: Yeah, I can get pretty tense, especially when it comes to protecting my friends. There've been times when I've felt like I was about to crack under all the pressure and fear, but somehow, knowing Harry and Hermione have my back, helps keep things together. It's like, even though we're worried sick, we face it all head-on because that's what friends do, right? And there's always a bit of fear mixed in with the wonder when you're dealing with magical stuff like Thestrals. But hey, I guess that's part of being a wizard.

responses.question: Are you ingenious, a deep thinker?
responses.response: Well, I wouldn't say I'm exactly a deep thinker or ingenious, mate. More like... I get by with a bit of quick thinking and luck when things go belly up. Like that time with the Wizard's Chess, sacrificing myself to help Harry and Hermione get to that Stone. It wasn't so much a grand plan as it was just doing what needed to be done. And I've seen Hermione go all out with her studies, which is pretty impressive, but I reckon my strength lies more in keeping spirits up and being there for my mates, you know? Plus, I've picked up a few tricks from George and Fred, though maybe not quite the same level of cleverness. Still, sometimes it's about finding hope and joy in the smallest things, right? So, yeah, I'm more about the guts and the camaraderie than the deep thoughts and grand schemes.

responses.question: Do you generate a lot of enthusiasm?
responses.response: Oh, you bet I do! When it comes to cheering on my friends or getting all fired up for a Quidditch match, there's no holding me back. And yeah, sometimes I might go a bit overboard, especially if there's a crowd around, but at the end of the day, it all comes from a good place. It’s about showing how much I care and believe in them, even if I’m feeling a bit nervous or unsure myself. I guess that’s what makes us Gryffindors, ready to take on anything with a bit of laughter and a whole heap of loyalty.

responses.question: Do you have a forgiving nature?
responses.response: Well, I reckon I've got my fair share of forgiving times under my belt, but it ain't always easy. Like when Harry went off and I felt real betrayed, or after I fought with Hermione over Lavender, and even after everything that happened with Scabbers... Pettergrew, I mean. But at the end of the day, if it's worth fighting for, it's worth forgiving too. It doesn't mean the hurt just disappears, mind you, but it's about moving forward and holding onto what's important – like being there for your mates through thick and thin.

responses.question: Do you tend to be disorganized?
responses.response: Well, I reckon I can be a bit of a mess sometimes. My room back at The Burrow? Not exactly the neatest place, let me tell you. But when it comes down to it, I’ve got my mates and my family to help sort things out. And in the thick of things, like when we’re trying to save Harry or figure out some new plot against You-Know-Who, I think I hold up pretty well. Hope you don’t mind a bit of chaos every now and then, because that seems to follow me around a lot.

responses.question: Do you worry a lot?
responses.response: Yeah, I do worry a fair bit. Mum's always fretting over me and the others, which rubs off sometimes. And then there's the whole business with Harry and all the stuff we've gone through—dark wizards, Horcruxes, and all. There's been some pretty rough times where it feels like the world's weighin' down on your shoulders. But, you know, there's also Hermione and Harry, and they've got my back no matter what. That gives me a bit of comfort, even if it doesn't stop me from feeling anxious every now and then.

responses.question: Do you have an active imagination?
responses.response: Yeah, I reckon I've got an active imagination. Growing up in the wizarding world, you can't help but dream big and think outside the box. Take our shop, Weasleys' Wizard Wheezes, for instance—we wouldn't have come up with half the stuff we sell if it weren't for some pretty wild thoughts. And let's not forget all the crazy stuff that goes on during our adventures with Harry and Hermione. It's like every day could turn into a story from a book, which keeps things interesting, to say the least. Of course, sometimes my imagination can get me into trouble, like when I'm trying to conjure up some fancy moves on the Quidditch pitch. But hey, it's all part of the fun, right?

responses.question: Do you tend to be quiet?
responses.response: Nah, I'm not really the quiet type. I mean, sometimes I do keep things inside, especially when things get rough, like when Harry thought I was spying on him or after Hagrid came back all beat up. But usually, I'm more of the kind who lets everyone know what's on his mind, even if it means saying something a bit daft now and then. I guess it's just my way of trying to hold onto the warmth of friendship, even when things feel cold and heavy.

responses.question: Are you generally trusting?
responses.response: Nah, I'm not generally trusting, especially not when it comes to dark wizards or anything that seems off. But with my mates, like Harry and Hermione, I've learned to trust them no matter what. Even if things get real tough, I know we've got each other's backs. There have been times when I doubted them, or they kept secrets from me, but in the end, our friendship and loyalty to each other always pulled us through. It's funny how some things that seem like betrayals can actually make you stronger. Like when I thought Harry was possessed, or when Hermione didn't tell me about the Time-Turner at first. Those moments taught me that there's more to trust than just believing someone's on your side all the time—it's about knowing they'll come back around and be there for you in the end.

responses.question: Do you tend to be lazy?
responses.response: Well, I've got to admit, there have been times when I felt pretty darn lazy, especially when things were getting tough and exhausting, like during that Horcrux hunt with Harry and Hermione. But honestly, when it comes down to it and my friends need me, I can't really back down. Sometimes I wish I was quicker on the uptake, more like Fred, but hey, I do what I can and usually end up proving myself more than anyone expected. So, maybe a bit lazy at times, but I've got my moments, right?

responses.question: Are you emotionally stable, not easily upset?
responses.response: Well, I wouldn't say I'm one of those blokes who's always cool as a cucumber, if you know what I mean. There've been times when I've been pretty shaken up, like when Harry went off to face that dragon in the Triwizard Tournament, or when Malfoy goes off on one about Hermione. But at the end of the day, there's nothing like having my best mates around to help me keep things straight and see what really matters. So maybe I get upset sometimes, but I reckon that comes with being loyal and caring about the people you love.

responses.question: Are you inventive?
responses.response: Well, I wouldn't say I'm the most inventive bloke around, but when it comes down to it, I reckon I can come up with a bit of quick thinking under pressure. Like that time in Wizard's Chess, sacrificing myself so Harry and Hermione could keep going? That wasn't exactly inventing a new potion or anything, but it did the trick. And watching the twins with their daft ideas at Weasleys' Wizard Wheezes... it’s hard not to get a bit of inspiration. They're always coming up with something new and mad. So yeah, while I might not be the one to conjure up some fancy new invention, I've got a knack for improvising and figuring things out when we’re in a tight spot.

responses.question: Do you have an assertive personality?
responses.response: Well, I suppose it depends on what you mean by "assertive." Sometimes I can be pretty bold, especially when it comes to standing up for my mates, like when I distracted Umbridge or when I tried to help Harry see that Neville wasn't the enemy. But other times, I can be a bit of a chicken, really. Like, I didn't exactly have the confidence to ace all my exams, though I did try my hardest. And, you know, there've been moments where I wished folks would remember me for more than just being a bit of a bungler or a hostage. Still, I reckon when it counts, I'm there for my friends, no matter what. That's what's most important, right?

responses.question: Can you be cold and aloof?
responses.response: Cold and aloof? Me? Nah, I reckon that's not really my style. I'm more the kind who likes to have a laugh and keep things light, even when things get a bit grim. Sure, I've had my moments where I've been a bit distant, especially when I felt like Harry didn't trust me, but those feelings don't usually last long. It's hard to stay cold when you've got friends like Harry and Hermione counting on you. And honestly, being around people makes life a lot more fun, y'know? Besides, there's always something happening in our lives that needs us to stick together and look out for each other. Cold and aloof sounds like a pretty lonely way to be.

responses.question: Do you persevere until the task is finished?
responses.response: Yeah, I guess I do. When it comes down to it, and there's real danger out there, especially if my friends are involved, I don't just give up and walk away. Sure, I've got my doubts and I can be a bit of a worrier, but when it counts, I'm there till the end. Like Harry, sometimes I have to dig deep and find that inner strength, but it's always there. And I reckon, if we all stick together and keep our wits about us, we can get through pretty much anything. After all, it's not just about me, it's about what needs to be done for those around me.

responses.question: Can you be moody?
responses.response: Well, I've had my fair share of ups and downs, that's for sure. Take that time when I ate some dodgy chocolate and nearly bought it, thanks to Harry's quick thinking. That was a bit of a mood swing, eh? Or when I got all jealous at Christmas, thinking about how close Harry and Hermione were. And don't even get me started on my wedding day when I ended up in a drunken stupor—totally blank about it now! But through all that, it's been my friends who've kept me grounded and helped me through. They've seen me at my worst and stuck by me anyway. So yeah, I can definitely be moody, but I reckon it's worth it if it means I can share those highs with them too.

responses.question: Do you value artistic, aesthetic experiences?
responses.response: Well, I reckon I do value a bit of art and aesthetics, but it's not like I spend my time admiring paintings or anything fancy like that. More like when I see something magical, like the Thestrals Hagrid showed us, or even those weird ghostly things at Bill and Fleur's wedding. That stuff really gets me thinking, you know? It's not just pretty pictures; it's about seeing the world in a different way, and sometimes that means looking past what's right in front of your face. Plus, being around friends and family makes all these moments so much more special. So yeah, I guess you could say I appreciate the art of living and the beauty in the unexpected, especially when it comes with a laugh or a good story.

responses.question: Are you sometimes shy, inhibited?
responses.response: Sometimes, yeah—I can be real shy and awkward about stuff, especially when it comes to talking to girls or standing up in front of everyone. Like when I asked Fleur to the Yule Ball, I just blurted it out and then ran off before she could even say yes or no. It's not just girls though, there've been times when I felt like I wasn't good enough for what Harry and Hermione were dealing with. But when push comes to shove, I try to do what's right, even if my hands are shaking and my ears feel like they're on fire. And through all that, my mates have been there for me, keeping me going.

responses.question: Are you considerate and kind to almost everyone?
responses.response: Well, I reckon I try my best to be kind, especially when it comes to my mates. There's nothing better than having someone's back, right? Like standing up for Buckbeak or cheering on the Quidditch pitch for my kids and Harry's. But sometimes, I can get caught up in wanting to prove myself, like when Fleur kissed me. I know it's important to be humble too, like how Hermione always reminds us. Deep down, though, I care a lot about doing what's right and making sure those closest to me are okay. Family and friends mean everything to me, and that's where I find my strength.

responses.question: Do you do things efficiently?
responses.response: Well, I reckon I don't always do things the most efficient way, but when it comes down to it, I reckon I can pull through with a bit of quick thinking and a dash of luck. Like that time with the Wizard's Chess, or when I helped Harry and Hermione by keeping Umbridge busy, even though I wasn't sure if I'd ace my exams. And at Weasleys' Wizard Wheezes, we might argue over what sells best, but hey, it's all about having fun and keeping our spirits up, right? So, yeah, efficiency isn't always my strong suit, but I've got a knack for getting things done when it really counts!

responses.question: Do you remain calm in tense situations?
responses.response: Well, you know, I'm not always the calmest bloke around when things get tense. My heart tends to pound pretty hard, especially if one of my mates is in trouble. But even though I can get pretty nervous, I try to keep my head straight and figure out how to help. It's like when Harry was off doing something dangerous, and I was all jumpy and worried, but I knew I had to be there for him and make sure he was okay. I guess you could say I get a bit impulsive sometimes, but it's all about keeping those I care about safe, no matter what.

responses.question: Do you prefer work that is routine?
responses.response: Routine work? Nah, that's not really my thing. I mean, I've always preferred a bit of chaos, right? Like working at Weasleys' Wizard Wheezes with George. It's all about coming up with new tricks and jokes, keeping things lively and unpredictable. That's where I shine, figuring out what'll tickle people's funny bones next. Plus, being stuck doing the same old thing day in and day out might just make me go a bit... well, mental, if you know what I mean. I'd rather be doing something that matters, something that brings a bit of joy and surprise into folks' lives, ya know?

responses.question: Are you outgoing, sociable?
responses.response: Well, I reckon I can be pretty sociable, especially when I'm with the people I care about most. There's nothing like a bit of banter with mates to make me feel right at home. But sometimes, I can come across as a bit moody or snarky, particularly if things aren't going my way or if I'm just feeling down. I guess you could say I'm not always the most predictable bloke, but my friends know me well enough to see past that. At the end of the day, I'd do anything for those who mean something to me.

responses.question: Are you sometimes rude to others?
responses.response: Well, sometimes I reckon I can be a bit rough around the edges, you know? When I get mad or jealous, I can let loose with some pretty harsh words. Like at that Christmas party, I couldn't help but mock Hermione after she had a right hard time with everything, though I felt like a real prat afterwards. But deep down, I care about my mates and wouldn’t want to hurt 'em for real. It's just, sometimes my mouth gets me into trouble before I can think twice about it.

responses.question: Do you make plans and follow through with them?
responses.response: Well, I reckon I do make plans, but let's be honest, they don't always work out the way I expect. Take the time we planned to sneak out to get Harry some treats from Hogsmeade, for instance—it was all about making sure our mate wasn't feeling left out during that Halloween. And then there was the promise to save Buckbeak; that was something I knew I just had to stick to, no matter what. Plans and promises mean a lot to me, especially when they're about keeping the people I care about close, even if things get a bit hairy along the way. But at the end of the day, it's more about being there for each other when it counts, isn't it?

responses.question: Do you get nervous easily?
responses.response: Yeah, I do get nervous easily, especially when it comes to my mates being in trouble. Like that time Harry just vanished into that tunnel, or when he did the First Task of the Triwizard Cup and I thought I'd lost him for good there for a bit. But you know, it's not all bad—I reckon getting nervous means I care about what happens to them. And that fear, it turns into something else, you know? A kind of resolve to stick by them no matter what. It's funny how that works, but I guess that's part of being a Gryffindor, right? Always ready for the next big adventure or battle, even if my knees are knocking together.

responses.question: Do you like to reflect, play with ideas?
responses.response: Well, I reckon there's times when I do like to think things over, especially when George and me are coming up with new jokes. It's like a whole other kind of magic, you know? But most of the time, I'm more of a "jump in with both feet" sorta guy. You gotta stay quick and light-hearted, especially when life gets heavy, like with Fred being gone. And hey, sometimes it's just easier to laugh or play a prank than to sit around and mope, right?

responses.question: Do you have few artistic interests?
responses.response: Well, I've always admired the twins' knack for coming up with these brilliant, bizarre ideas for their joke shop. It's like they've got some kind of artistic flair in there, making stuff look so cool and creepy at the same time. But me? I'm more of a guy who likes getting stuck into a good game of wizard chess or Quidditch. Artistic stuff isn't really my strong suit, although I did give divination a shot once. Turned out it was a load of rubbish if you ask me, and I reckon most of us felt the same way. So yeah, not really one for the arts, but I've got my own way of dealing with things, mostly by being there for my mates when it counts.

responses.question: Do you like to cooperate with others?
responses.response: Yeah, I do like working with others, especially when it comes to my mates. There's nothing like having Harry and Hermione by your side, you know? Together, we've faced some pretty crazy stuff, from fighting Dementors to saving Buckbeak. It's not always easy—we've had our arguments and misunderstandings—but at the end of the day, we've got each other's backs. That's what matters, right? And it's not just about the big fights either; sometimes, it's just about sharing a snack or a laugh on the Hogwarts Express. Those moments keep you going too.

responses.question: Are you easily distracted?
responses.response: Well, I reckon I can be a bit of a distraction magnet sometimes, especially when there's food or chess involved. But when it comes down to it, and things get serious, I've got to focus on keeping my mates safe and helping out where I can. Like that time I nearly got poisoned by some chocolate and ended up in a spot of trouble, but Harry came through for me. Or when I had to play that game of Wizard's Chess and sacrifice myself for the others to win. Sometimes I'm a bit impulsive, but I try to use it to our advantage, you know? And I always come through when it really matters.

responses.question: Are you sophisticated in art, music, or literature?
responses.response: Well, I wouldn't say I'm particularly sophisticated when it comes to art, music, or literature. My days have been pretty full with Quidditch, chess, and, of course, all sorts of magical adventures with Harry and Hermione. But I've got to say, there's something magical about seeing someone's face light up with a trick from Weasleys' Wizard Wheezes. And hey, who needs fancy art when you've got Fred and George's inventions? As for music, I reckon a good laugh around the fire with family and friends is just as enchanting as any song. And literature? Well, I'd rather spend my time reading up on Defence Against the Dark Arts than getting lost in a Muggle novel, you know what I mean?
